dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: There was no meaning in it here.  The whole thing to them was some sort of bus accident.  Then I went to work for dad and that whole rat race again.  I felt, what you said, ashamed somehow

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: because nobody was changed.  It seemed to make suckers out of a lot of guys.  I felt wrong to be alive;

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: to open that bank book; to drive the new car; to see the new refrigerator.  I mean, you can take these things out of a war, but when you drive the new car, you have to know that it came out of the love a man can have for a man.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You have to be a little better because of that.  Otherwise, we have is really loot and there's blood on it.  I don't want to take any of it.  I guess that included you.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And do you still feel that way?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I want you now, Annie.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Because you mustn't feel that way anymore, Chris.  Because you have a right to everything you have, everything, Chris; to me, too.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And your money, there's nothing wrong in your money.  Your father put hundreds of planes in the air.  You should be proud.  A man should be paid for that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Annie, Annie, I'm going to make you a fortune.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What'll I do with a fortune?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So, um, well, I just -- I kind of wanted to, you know, tell you that I'm actually -- I proposed to Kate and we're going to get married.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Wait, what?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah. Yeah, I proposed to her yesterday. We're getting -- we're engaged now and we're going to -- we're going to get married in about eight months.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, my God.  Congratulations.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's pretty amazing, huh?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I can't -- how did you do it?  What happened?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well I decided to take her sailing

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: and we were just out on the water and, you know, I just -- I had the ring with me.  And I was like let's do this.  And she was like okay and then we're getting married.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: [LAUGHTER] Well you paint a romantic picture.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well I didn't want it to be like cheesy, you know.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Did she cry?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: She didn't cry, but she was laughing a lot and it was very exciting, so...

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, my God.  How long have you been planning on doing this?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Honestly, it was kind of quickly.  It was actually only in the past couple months.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I can't believe this.  You're getting married. It's crazy!

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah. Yeah. So- I know.  I know. I know.  It's weird 'cause it's like the beginning of the rest of my life, you know.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah, it is.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: But uh- no, I mean, you know.  You know, I really want you to like, you know, sort of

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: help Kate out with like planning stuff. I mean, if you want to.  I mean, you guys are good friends anyway so I figured, you know, if you guys want to like -- I mean, you know, I'm sure you enjoy that kind of thing.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah, I would love to. Thanks. [LAUGHTER]

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Okay. Well there you go.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, my God, where -- have you guys talked about where you're going to get married or--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I think we're going to -- we're going to -- we want to do it in Hawaii and just fly everybody in.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, my God.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I just -- 'cause, I mean, Hawaii just has like the best fruit buffets.  And so I'm just going to say forget, you know, all like kind of meats and all that stuff.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's just going to be like a all fruit--fruit buffet wedding, plus a cake.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Are you going to get married like on the beach barefoot or like fancier?  Like in a church.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Barefoot?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well I don't know.  Throwing it out there.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Um, no, no, no.  It'll be in like a park near the beach.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah.  But I'm really excited.  So and everybody's going to come out and it'll be a great time.  And--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Are you going to have a big wedding or like keep it really small like just, you know, family and really close friends?  Or, I mean--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It'll be kind of small, but not, you know, not tiny, you know.  I want to have, you know, as many people as we can afford to fly out to Hawaii and put up there for--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's so exciting.  What's the ring look like?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's big and shiny.  I don't know.  It's silver and--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Big and shiny.  You're such a guy. [LAUGHTER]

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah, I don't know. [LAUGHTER] But, yeah, so anyway -- well I wanted to tell you that, you know, 'cause you're one of my good friends and you're Kate's- one of her best friends and-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm so excited for you. That's great. I'm so-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah. She was actually -- she was going to tell you but I told her that I wanted to tell you and she had to work today anyway, so I decided to-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well I'm glad you told me.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's fantastic.  I -- congratulations. It's amazing.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Thank you.  I'm really -- I'm really excited.  And it's -- I don't know, it's like a little -- it's like a little scary, 'cause I'm like, ah, you know, it's the first time I've ever done anything like this.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: But, you know, it's like I really love her and I really just -- I can't imagine spending my life with anybody else but her.  So, you know, it's like I know that's the right thing.  And if you have to, you know, if you have to question that, you know, don't- don't do it.  So we're going to do it.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And it's going to -- the -- you know, I told her that I just -- I want the color brown to be as an integral in the wedding.  And, um, maybe some greens and blues.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And how did she feel about that?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: She's okay with it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well that's good.  It'll be a great wedding.  You're willing to compromise on things.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Exactly, exactly, exactly.  So--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: She's going to let you have say in the wedding choices?  That's pretty impressive. Very forward-thinking woman. [LAUGHTER]

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well, I mean I just told her--Well I just said, you know, hey, these are my suggestions.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And brown.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: All fruit and the color brown. Just that. That's all- that's my only request.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: This is why men don't plan weddings. [LAUGHTER]

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah.  Well maybe--maybe you're right. Maybe there's something to that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: All fruit and brown. [LAUGHTER]

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So, um, anyway, do you want to order now?   So, um I mean--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah, hi.  Look--Um, okay.  Here's the thing.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Hi, how can I help you?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Just arrived from London--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Mmhmm.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: lost my luggage. Your airline--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Right.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: lost my luggage. I didn't lose it. No, it's not like I left it somewhere and somebody took it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, oh, you didn't.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I thought you lost your luggage.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It was lost.  I waited on the conveyor -- near the conveyor belt to see, you know, where -- then the baggage claim and see if it would- it would come out.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Didn't come out.  I spoke to somebody, a local authority figure.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And he told me to come to this desk here so I can, uh, at least get, uh, the hundred- hundred and fifty dollars that- that I'm owed for my loss.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: 'Cause that's roughly how much the bag plus all its contents was worth.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Uh. Okay.  I -- first of all, I'm very sorry you lost your bag.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Um, but, actually, our policy is a fifty dollar

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: fifty dollars?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: refund--coverage of the bag that was lost. yes

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: fifty dollars. No way, no.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: That's our policy, sir.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't but the thing is, I don't care about your policy.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You understand?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What I want you to do is I want you to write three of those, as if I were three people.  Okay.  You can write -- you can just put my name on all --

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I can't do that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: But what I'm telling you is that's what you're going to do.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Uh, no, actually, no I'm not.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, no, because, look, I don't care what your policy says.  I mean--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm very sorry.  I understand you're frustrated. You just got off of a flight.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You understand that the contents of my bag- The contents of my bag cost a hundred and fifty dollars.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: We'll cover fifty.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No.  No.  No.  What I need you to do -- I need you to write checks for -- I need you to write three of them. That'll be satisfactory.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: We only cover fifty do-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Just -- you can fill out the form--We can fill out - no, no, no, we can fill out the form three times.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: We only cover fifty dollars worth of lost items.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: And then that'll be that. It's going to be fine. Just-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'm going to get very upset.  Like, I mean, I'm- I'm upset right now but I'm going to get really upset if you- if you don't do the check thing.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm very sorry.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm very sorry.  I understand you're upset.  You just got off a long flight.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You don't understand. You don't understand, actually.  You don't understand because it was my luggage that was lost.  Okay.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: We really -- we want to work with you. We really -- we want to help.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I understand that.  I would know if it was mine. Um-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah.  If it was yours, but it's not. It's mine.  Okay. So just--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: But it's not.  It's yours.  I understand.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I know.  We want to work with you.  We will give you the fifty dollars but I'm--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, it's not going to be -- but it's not going to be fifty, it's going to be a hundred and fifty.  You're going to write three, you understand, three of- of the forms.  You're going to write three of them out and then give it to me.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah, we don't do that.  I can go ahead and send you--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You- you- you- you're misunderstanding me.  You're going to do that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: We will definitely keep an eye out for your bag. We will try to find it.  We will, you know, fill out the form for missing items.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Look, can I just -- can I speak to your manager, please?  'Cause I- I really -- I don't, um -- I mean, I just don't want to deal with -- I know that -- I mean, I know this isn't your fault,

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No one can make the three check thing happen 'cause we don't do that.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I can write you the one check.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: but I need to speak to somebody who can make the three check thing happen.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: All- all that my supervisor could do is the exact same thing that I'm offering to do.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: But what I'm talk -- but I'm just,just- please let me--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: But if I could just speak directly -- if I could just speak directly to your-- to your superior person

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'd be happy to give you a cup of coffee, too.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: We'll just throw that in--gratuitously.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: then that would be helpful to me because I just feel like if- you don't think you have the power to write three checks but you actually do. see?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: No, I don't. See, I could lose my job if I did that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: But your job is not my concern. My concern is getting my luggage.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And your bag is not my concern.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: The fifty dollars I'm going to give you for your bag is really all I'm concerned with.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Look, I don't -- look, can we just not argue about this.  Like--

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm more than happy to not argue about it.  I will give you your fifty dollar certificate.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You can go ahead and go fill out the form. We'll look for your bag.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So what if- what if we- what if we do three forms

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: with different names on them? That-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Then that would be lying.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: but, no. See, 'cause

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: if we have three forms then I can get the hundred and fifty.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm sorry.  We can only issue one fifty dollar certificate to cover the lost bag for one person.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Just please, will you please just work with me here? Just -- all I'm asking you to do is just work with me. I know -- I know that you get lots of people all day long who give you shit, give you crap, but

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I understand you're frustrated, but--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: um, you know, I -- this is my bag and I need the hundred and fifty dollars. Please.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I know. I understand it's personal-- It's personal to you. I get that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Please.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: But if you want to just sit down, you know, maybe have a cup of tea, calm down a little bit, we'll go ahead and we'll do what we can for you. you okey

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I'm already calm. Okay, I'm calm. I'm calm.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Just all I need you to do is just fill out three forms and I'll leave you alone forever, forever.  I'll never -- we'll never see each other again.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And I'm looking forward to that.  However, I can't do that. I would lose my job.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: But that's not going to-- But you don't understand. You're looking forward to never seeing me again.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, yes.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: But never seeing me again is not going to happen until you give me the three checks.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, really.  But--

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't -- I'm not- I'm not convinced.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: That I'm sorry?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah.  If you were really sorry, you'd give me the three checks.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So why don't we just do that and stop this nonsense, hmm?  Hmm?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Hey, I'm, uh. I'm really sorry about what happened.  I don't um- I mean what you can you do?  I mean it's-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Thanks.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: When I was seven, my- my grandmother died and I really- I don't know, I mean it was really hard to let go but the important thing is- is that you do let go and your realize that, you know, they- you know, they- this person had fun while they were- while they were here and, uh, you know, you work- you work through it.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: You know it's just, I just, you know, I mean it just happened.  I just, like- I just keep expecting him to walk in, you know.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Mmhmm. Yeah.  Yeah.  I mean it's- it's hard.  It's hard.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: I just- I just thought he would have longer, you know, because I'm- I mean when he found out he was sick, we knew that wasn't good but I just- I just thought that it would take longer, you know?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Well I mean, you know, I mean it was I mean with that kind of condition,

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah. I know. I know.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: you know, it's inevitable  and I mean honestly it's- it's almost like

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: you know, you don't- you know, how long do you want the person to go through that, you know.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's sort of- it's almost better off to rest in peace than he is to live in pain.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah, I know. But I'd rather have him here with me, you know. It's just not fair.  I mean he- he didn't get to do like anything. I mean he was-

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: He was only twenty four and just so many things that we were going to do, you know, and now he won't get to do them and he won't get to be here when I do.  You know, like I'll get married some day and he won't be there, like, he won't get to see that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It just doesn't seem fair.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It's not fair but I mean that's, you know, the course of life is that, you know, you meet people and you lose them.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You're okay

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Thank you for being here.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You know I think- I think we should celebrate because I think that's what he would have wanted.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: [LAUGHTER] You're probably right.  He probably would be pissed if we were all sitting around being upset about it. He'd want us to have a party.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: And to drink in his honor. [LAUGHTER]

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: That's right.  That's right.  I mean he would want us to, you know, celebrate the life that he- that he lived and, you know, enjoy the rest of ours as much as we can.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yeah, I know.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So-

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Good God.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Do you think it's them?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I wonder.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Nobody knows we're here, except Freda and she wouldn't ring up.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It must be them, then.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What are we to do?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: We'll be alright, darling.  Whatever happens, aren't we?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Now and always sweet.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't care, then.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It was bound to come sooner or later.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Hello, hello.  What?  Wrong number.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, it sent shivers up my spine.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What shall we do if they suddenly walk in on us?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Behave exquisitely.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: With the mo- with the most perfect poise?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Certainly.  I shall probably do a court curtsey.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Ah.  Things that ought to matter dreadfully don't matter when one's happy, do they?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: But what's so horrible is that one can't stay happy.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Don't say that, darling.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: It's true.  The whole business is a very poor joke.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Meaning that sacred and beautiful thing, love?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Yes, meaning just that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: What does it all mean?  That's what I ask myself in my ceaseless quest for ultimate truth.  Dear God, what does it all mean?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Don't laugh at me.  I'm serious.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: You mustn't be serious, my dear.  That's just what they want.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Who's they?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: All the futile moralists who try to make life unbearable.  Laugh at them.  Be flippant.  Laugh at everything.  All their sacred shibboleths.  Flippancy brings out the acid- acid in their damn sweetness and light.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: If I laugh at everything, I must laugh at us, too.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Certainly you must.  We're figures of fun alright.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: How long will it last, this ludicrous and overbearing love of ours?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Who knows.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Shall we always want to bicker and fight?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No.  That fire will fade along with our passion.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, dear.  Should we like that.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: It all depends on how well we've played.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: What happens if one of us dies?  Does the one that's left, still laugh?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Yes.  Yes, with all his might.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Well that's serious enough, isn't it?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: No, no, it isn't.  Death's very laughable; such a cunning little mystery, all done with mirrors.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Darling, I believe you're talking nonsense.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: So is everyone else in the long run.  Let's be superficial and pity the poor philosophers.  Let's blow trumpets and squeakers and- and enjoy the party as much as we can, like very small, quite idiotic little school children.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Let's savor the delight of the moment.  Come and kiss me, darling, before your body rots and worms pop in and out of your eye sockets.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Elliot, worms don't pop.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: I don't mind what you do, see?  You can paint yourself bright green all over and dance naked in the Place Vendome and rush off madly with all the men in the world and I shan't say a word as long as you love me best.

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Thank you, dear.  The same applies to you, except that if I catch you so much as looking at another woman, I will kill you.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Do you remember that awful scene we had in Venice?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Which particular one?

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: The one when you bought that little painted wooded snake and put it on my bed?

dialogue.speaker: F
dialogue.text: Oh, Charles; that was his name, Charles.  Oh, he did wriggle so beautifully.

dialogue.speaker: M
dialogue.text: Horrible thing.  I hated it.

dialogue.speaker: F
